page.title: 11Camping at Coney Green Farm
page.content: During the Whitsun holiday I went to Coney Green Farm with the Cubs for a camping trip. At the farm there is a wide green for caravans and tents. There are goats,sheep, ducks, a few cows,geese and other farm animals. There is a stream nearby, called the Gladderbrook,which goes to the River Severn.It is very deep and goes past my head.The owners of the farm are MR and MRS Gould. At Cubs I did 2 badges and some map reading.The first badge was exploring. We went into the wood by the green. There were a lot of tracks to walk along. We also made a den with wood and fern leaves.The other badge was campers and we made a wooden washing-up stand.
